snippet.title: Three Surprising Hazards Of Worksite Wellness Programs
snippet.description: Here’s a proposal for the plot of a new comic book. Perry White summons Clark Kent and Lois Lane into his office one day in Metropolis. “I have bad news,” White barks. “Health costs at the Daily Planet are through the roof. And it’s all your fault. You’re unhealthy!” White tells Clark and [...] read »

snippet.title: Quoth Harvard Professor: 'Facebook Is A Short'
snippet.description: CAMBRIDGE, MA - NOVEMBER 7: Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg speaks to reporters at Harvard University November 7, 2011 in Cambridge, Massachusetts. (Image credit: Getty Images via @daylife) Harvard Business School Associate Professor Ben Edelman says that Facebook stock is a short. snippet.title: Global Poverty: The Real Reason Most People Won't Wear Google Glasses
snippet.description: In my last post on Google Glasses, I explored the idea of a coming seamless integration of technology. What we know as “gadgets” may soon blend into our environments, possibly leading to more productivity and innovation. One concern is how this shift will impact the global wealth gap: "if the haves [...] read »

snippet.title: Epic Games President Mike Capps Looks to the Future
snippet.description: VideoCARY, North Carolina – Epic Games has launched the final chapter in its bestselling Gears of War trilogy, but it’s not the end of the Microsoft franchise by any means. snippet.title: The Magical Umbrella of Leadership: A Christmas Lesson from a Trappist Monk
snippet.description: In 2004 I won the Templeton Foundation’s, Power of Purpose essay contest. It is the story of a chance encounter with a Trappist monk on a cold Christmas Eve. Happy holidays. I hope you learn as much from Brother John as I did. read »

snippet.title: The Arab World Needs (Entrepreneurial) Heroes
snippet.description: Written By Saad Khan Dubai is a city that defies the laws of physics. It is a place where architects are regularly commissioned to build the Dali-esque. Tallest building in the world? Check. Islands in the shapes of Palm Trees? Done. Want Whistler-like ski conditions in a shopping mall [...] read »

snippet.title: Neuroscientist Bradley Voytek is Bringing the Silicon Valley Ethos into Academia
snippet.description: Edge Thinker and Neuroscientist Bradley Voytek discusses using data mining in science, how Silicon Valley clashes with academia, and why the zombie brain needs study. read »
